intro: Aeschynomene lorentziana, commonly known as the purplestem aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, bean-like pods containing seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural settings.
